intro: Cinchona chlorrhiza, commonly known as the yellow quinine tree, is a species native to the Andean regions of South America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its yellowish bark and lance-shaped leaves. The plant is notable for its historical use in the production of quinine, a compound used to treat malaria. Cinchona chlorrhiza typically grows in humid, shaded environments at high altitudes. Its botanical features include a smooth, reddish-brown trunk and small, white flowers that bloom in clusters.
